meanings.definition: Used as the object of a verb or preposition to refer to the speaker as the object of an action or preposition.
meanings.sent1: I hurt myself when I fell off the bike.
meanings.sent2: I can do it myself without any help.
meanings.sent3: I found myself in a silly situation after trying to juggle too many things.
meanings.sent4: I pushed myself to the limit during the race.
meanings.sent5: I reminded myself to stay calm in stressful situations.

meanings.definition: Used for emphasis or to refer to the speaker alone.
meanings.sent1: I myself saw the rainbow after the rain.
meanings.sent2: I want to do it myself to feel accomplished.
meanings.sent3: I amused myself by trying to balance a spoon on my nose.
meanings.sent4: I felt like a superhero myself when I helped someone in need.
meanings.sent5: I treated myself to a delicious ice cream cone as a reward.
